segments.en: Numbered Discourses 11
2. Recollection
12. With Mahānāma (2nd)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mahānāmo sakko gilānā vuṭṭhito hoti aciravuṭṭhito gelaññā.
segments.en: Now at that time Mahānāma the Sakyan had recently recovered from an illness.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṃ karonti:
segments.en: At that time several mendicants were making a robe for the Buddha …
Mahānāma the Sakyan heard about this.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: He went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
“Sir, I have heard that
several mendicants are making a robe for the Buddha, thinking that
when his robe was finished and the three months of the rains residence had passed the Buddha would set out wandering.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṃ kenassa vihārena vihātabban”ti?
segments.en: Now, we spend our life in various ways. Which of these should we practice?”
“Good, good, Mahānāma!

segments.pli: Etaṃ kho, mahānāma, tumhākaṃ patirūpaṃ kulaputtānaṃ yaṃ tumhe tathāgataṃ upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha:
segments.en: It’s appropriate that gentlemen such as you come to me and ask:

segments.pli: ‘tesaṃ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṃ kenassa vihārena vihātabban’ti?
segments.en: ‘We spend our life in various ways. Which of these should we practice?’

segments.pli: Saddho kho, mahānāma, ārādhako hoti, no assaddho;
segments.en: The faithful succeed, not the faithless.
The energetic succeed, not the lazy.
The mindful succeed, not the unmindful.
Those with immersion succeed, not those without immersion.
The wise succeed, not the witless.

segments.pli: Imesu kho tvaṃ, mahānāma, pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cha dhamme uttari bhāveyyāsi.
segments.en: When you’re grounded on these five things, go on to develop six further things.
Firstly, you should recollect the Realized One:

segments.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
segments.en: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako tathāgataṃ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects the Realized One their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti tathāgataṃ ārabbha.
segments.en: At that time their mind is unswerving, based on the Realized One.

segments.pli: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhammūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: A noble disciple whose mind is unswerving finds joy in the meaning and the teaching, and finds joy connected with the teaching.

segments.pli: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vediyati, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
segments.en: When they’re joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when they’re blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.

segments.pli: Imaṃ kho tvaṃ, mahānāma, buddhānussatiṃ gacchantopi bhāveyyāsi, ṭhitopi bhāveyyāsi, nisinnopi bhāveyyāsi, sayānopi bhāveyyāsi, kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhahantopi bhāveyyāsi, puttasambādhasayanaṃ ajjhāvasantopi bhāveyyāsi.
segments.en: You should develop this recollection of the Buddha while walking, standing, sitting, lying down, while working, and while at home with your children.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ tvaṃ, mahānāma, dhammaṃ anussareyyāsi … pe …
segments.en: Furthermore, you should recollect the teaching …
the Saṅgha …
your own ethical conduct …
your own generosity …
the deities …

segments.pli: Yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā saṃvijjati.
paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā paññā saṃvijjatī’ti.

Yasmiṃ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako attano ca tāsañca devatānaṃ saddhañca sīlañca sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarati, nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hoti;
segments.en: When a noble disciple recollects the faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom of both themselves and the deities their mind is not full of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: ujugatamevassa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti devatā ārabbha.
segments.en: At that time their mind is unswerving, based on the deities.

segments.pli: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhammūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.
segments.en: A noble disciple whose mind is unswerving finds joy in the meaning and the teaching, and finds joy connected with the teaching.

segments.pli: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṃ vediyati, sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati.
segments.en: When they’re joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when they’re blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.

segments.pli: Imaṃ kho tvaṃ, mahānāma, devatānussatiṃ gacchantopi bhāveyyāsi, ṭhitopi bhāveyyāsi, nisinnopi bhāveyyāsi, sayānopi bhāveyyāsi, kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhahantopi bhāveyyāsi, puttasambādhasayanaṃ ajjhāvasantopi bhāveyyāsī”ti.
segments.en: You should develop this recollection of the deities while walking, standing, sitting, lying down, while working, and while at home with your children.”

suttaplex.blurb: Mahānāma the Sakyan sees that the monks are preparing robes after the rains season. Knowing that the Buddha will soon depart, he asks how they are to live with their busy lives.
